summary:
Serotonin syndrome (SS) is a serious condition that can happen when you take certain medicines that increase serotonin levels in your body. Symptoms can be mild, like high blood pressure, or severe, like high fever and seizures. It's usually caused by combining two or more medications like antidepressants or drugs like amphetamines.

Doctors diagnose it by checking your symptoms and medicines. Treatment involves stopping the medicines causing the problem and sometimes using other drugs to help. With quick treatment, most people recover, but it can be life-threatening if not treated.
title: Serotonin syndrome
